articles.title: Kim Jong Un Greets Chinese President
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Greets Chinese President
 Pyongyang, March 14 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, Thursday sent a congratulatory message to Xi Jinping, general secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China, president of the People's Republic of China and chairman of the Central Military Commission of the PRC.
					 The message said:
					
					 I would like to send warm congratulations to you on your election as president of the People's Republic of China and chairman of the Central Military Commission of the PRC at the first session of the 12th National People's Congress of the PRC.
					
					 Your assumption of the heavy responsibility as the state leader is an expression of the Chinese people and army's deep respect and trust in you. 
					
					 It is my hope that the Chinese people will register greater successes in building a comprehensively well-off socialist society in all fields under the leadership of the CPC with you as general secretary.
					
					 It is the consistent stand of our party and the DPRK government to value and consolidate and develop the DPRK-China friendship.
					
					 I wish you success in your responsible work in the belief that the traditional relations of friendship and cooperation between the DPRK and China will grow strong steadily and successfully thanks to the common efforts of the two sides.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Sends Reply Messages to Different Countries
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Sends Reply Messages to Different Countries
 Pyongyang, March 14 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, sent messages to heads of state of different countries in reply to their congratulatory messages on the occasion of the 71st birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 They were Thein Sein, president of Myanmar, Bashar Al-Assad, president of Syria, Joseph Kabila Kabange, president of Democratic Congo, and Yoweri Kaguta Museveni, president of Uganda.
					
					 He in the messages wished them successes in their work for stability and prosperity of their countries, expressing conviction that the relations of friendship and cooperation between the DPRK and those countries would grow stronger.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets Chinese President, Chairman of NPC Standing Committee
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets Chinese President, Chairman of NPC Standing Committee
 Pyongyang, March 14 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Thursday sent a congratulatory message to Xi Jinping on his election as president of the People's Republic of China and Zhang Dejiang as chairman of the Standing Committee of the Chinese National People's Congress at the first session of the 12th National People's Congress.
					 Kim in the message wished the Chinese people shining successes in the efforts to achieve the country's prosperity under the leadership of the Communist Party of China.
					
					 He wished them successes in their responsible jobs, expressing belief that the traditional relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries would grow stronger thanks to the common efforts of the two sides.

articles.title: Yang Hyong Sop Meets New Indian Ambassador
articles.content:
Yang Hyong Sop Meets New Indian Ambassador
 Pyongyang, March 14 (KCNA) -- Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, met and had a talk with new Indian Ambassador to the DPRK Ajay Kumar Sharma, who paid a courtesy call on him at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Thursday.

articles.title: FM Spokesman Hits Out at US for Contending AA Can't Be Dissolved Unilaterally
articles.content:
FM Spokesman Hits Out at US for Contending AA Can't Be Dissolved Unilaterally
 Pyongyang, March 14 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Foreign Ministry of the DPRK gave the following answer to a question put by KCNA Thursday as the U.S. and the forces kowtowing to it are insisting that the Korean Armistice Agreement (AA) can not be unilaterally dissolved:
					 The Supreme Command of the Korean People's Army announced that the AA will be totally nullified from March 11 when the U.S. nuclear war exercises aimed to stifle the DPRK get into full swing.
					
					 Accordingly the army and people of the DPRK turned out in an all-out action for foiling the U.S. moves aimed at a nuclear war and reunifying the country at an early date, completely unrestrained by AA.
					
					 But the U.S. and its allies are asserting that AA was adopted with mutual agreement and can not be dissolved unilaterally. This shows a sleight of hand they have employed to use the threadbare AA for escaping the DPRK's toughest counteraction.
					
					 Unlike other agreements, AA is not one that requires bilateral agreement to be rendered invalid from its peculiar nature and it will be naturally nullified if one side does not abide by it.
					
					 AA has long been invalid due to the systematic scrapping of it by the U.S. and the unreasonable behavior of the UN Security Council that backed the U.S. moves for the last six decades.
					
					 Armistice could remain though in name only because the DPRK exercised utmost self-restraint and patience.
					
					 The U.S. and the south Korean puppet forces are now holding Key Resolve and Foal Eagle joint military drills to light a fuse for a nuclear war with the involvement of huge aggression troops, the biggest violation of AA and an act of scrapping it.
					
					 Under the prevailing situation which is little different from a war in fact, the DPRK can no longer be bound to AA.
					
					 This is a stark reality in which AA is no longer valid.
					
					 The U.S. will have to hold full responsibility for scrapping and finally nullifying AA, in case the situation entails a catastrophic consequence on the Korean Peninsula.

articles.title: FM Spokesman Slams UN Secretary General
articles.content:
FM Spokesman Slams UN Secretary General
 Pyongyang, March 14 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Foreign Ministry of the DPRK gave the following answer to a question raised by KCNA Thursday in connection with the fact that the UN secretary general has slandered the DPRK by openly pursuing the U.S. hostile policy toward it:
					 UN Secretary General Ban Ki-moon has recently let loose a string of invectives slandering the inviolable dignity and sovereignty of the DPRK, all the while defending the U.S. hostile acts against it.
					
					 Ban said that he was deeply concerned about the violation of the resolution of the UN Security Council, in clear reference to the DPRK's peaceful satellite launch and the nuclear test for self-defence. He also made such a coarse invective that the Korean leadership must make efforts to scrap nuclear program and improve the people's living. He even defended the U.S. nuclear war exercises against the DPRK.
					
					 This proves that he has become so biased as to openly support the hostile forces in their moves for stifling and isolating a sovereign state, a UN member, oblivious of the elementary principle of activities as an official of the international body. 
					
					 Unbecoming his post as UN Secretary General, Ban is not yet away from his behavior of kowtowing to the U.S. as south Korean "minister of Foreign Affairs and Trade". There is outcry among public often that it is unclear whether he is a spokesman for the U.S. Department of State or south Korean "minister of Foreign Affairs and Trade".
					
					   He should observe neutrality, impartiality and objectivity in his work, to begin with, as becoming his position.
					
					  If Ban has even an iota of conscience as a Korean, he should not add oil to the flames, subservient to the U.S., but come to his senses and do something helpful to national unity and the peaceful reunification of the country.

articles.title: Provocateurs Will Face Retaliatory Strike Anytime: CPRK
articles.content:
Provocateurs Will Face Retaliatory Strike Anytime: CPRK
 Pyongyang, March 14 (KCNA) -- The Secretariat of the Committee for the Peaceful Reunification of Korea issued the following information bulletin No. 1022 on Thursday:
					 The U.S. imperialists and the south Korean puppet warmongers are busy staging the madcap Key Resolve and Foal Eagle joint military exercises, pushing the situation on the Korean Peninsula to a more reckless phase.
					
					 In view of the grave situation, the DPRK declared at home and abroad that the Korean Armistice Agreement and all the north-south agreements on nonaggression would be nullified from March 11 when the saber-rattling is going into full swing and it would take stronger countermeasures in succession.
					
					 Pursuant to this, the army and people of the DPRK have taken positions for a final attack for national reunification and all sophisticated strike means including nuclear strike means are waiting for an order to hit the targets. 
					
					 The important measures declared by the DPRK are a proper counteraction against the high-handed hostile actions of the U.S. imperialists and the puppet forces and their reckless moves to invade the north and ultimatum to them.
					
					 Nevertheless, the puppet forces are challenging the DPRK's measures, jabbering that they are "escalating tension" and "south Korea would strongly react to the attempt to scrap the agreements".
					
					 The puppet authorities and despicable reptile media are taking issue with the DPRK's important measures everyday, talking about "agreement of both sides", "international recognition" and the like. Not content with this, they are insisting that the saber-rattling is a "defensive drill being staged every year within the framework of the Armistice Agreement".
					
					 As recognized at home and abroad, the AA and the agreements on nonaggression have long been violated and reduced to dead papers by the U.S. imperialists and the south Korean puppet forces.
					
					 They are the very ones and arch criminals who have systematically violated the AA and the agreements on nonaggression since the very moment they were adopted and took effect.
					
					 All legal mechanisms for preventing military conflicts have become defunct in this land due to the unprecedented moves of the U.S. and the south Korean puppet forces to stifle the DPRK and their endless provocations, pushing the grave situation beyond control.
					
					 The U.S. nuclear carrier task forces and nuclear strategic bombers aimed to attack the DPRK have been busy operating in the seas of south Korea and its vicinity and the air above them all the year round. Consequently, not a day passes without provocative exercises for a war of aggression against the DPRK.
					
					 As a result, the Korean Peninsula has turned into the most dangerous hotspot in the world and a dangerous nuclear arsenal where even a spark may ignite a nuclear war.
					
					 It is the height of shamelessness for provocateurs coming in attack to talk about the AA and the preservation of the agreements on non-aggression.
					
					 The puppet group is going so ridiculous as to describe the DPRK's resolute decision as "threat" and "psychological warfare".
					
					  The aggressors and provocateurs should face up to the prevailing situation.
					
					 They are sadly mistaken if they misinterpret the present grave situation as a verbal confrontation just as they did in the past.
					
					 The provocateurs will not be able to escape retaliatory blows at any moment.
					
					 The army and people of the DPRK will blow up all the strongholds and bases of the aggressors and provocateurs fond of playing with fire as they had declared before.
					
					 The disturbers of peace, war provocateurs and the chieftain of fratricidal confrontation can never find their shelters to escape our just strike.
					
					 The south Korean puppet group had better behave itself.

articles.title: Officials Visit Lodgings of Participants in Light Industrial Meeting
articles.content:
Officials Visit Lodgings of Participants in Light Industrial Meeting
 Pyongyang, March 14 (KCNA) -- Senior party and state officials Thursday called at lodgings of the participants in a national meeting of light industrial workers.
					 They included Choe Yong Rim, Kim Ki Nam and officials of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					
					 They congratulated the officials and workers who came here to participate in the meeting with pride of contributing to improving the standard of people's living by hastening the modernization of light industry and producing a plenty of quality consumer goods.
					
					 They called upon the participants to further glorify the undying feats of leader Kim Jong Il by keeping production going at a high rate at modern light industrial factories and production bases provided by him, and make sure that the warm loving care of the Workers' Party of Korea reaches the people.

articles.title: Participants in Light Industrial Meeting Visit Kumsusan Palace of Sun
articles.content:
Participants in Light Industrial Meeting Visit Kumsusan Palace of Sun
 Pyongyang, March 14 (KCNA) -- The participants in a national meeting of light industrial workers Thursday visited the Kumsusan Palace of the Sun.
					 They bowed to the statues of Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.
					
					 They looked round the halls of immortality where the Generalissimos lie in state.
					
					 They went round the halls where orders the Generalissimos received are on display and the halls which house cars, an electric car, a boat and train coaches used by them during their field guidance and foreign trips till the last moments of their lives.

articles.title: Floral Basket Laid before Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Floral Basket Laid before Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
 Pyongyang, March 14 (KCNA) -- Those to participate in a national meeting of light industrial workers laid a floral basket before the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill on Thursday.
					 They laid floral basket and bouquets before the statues in deep reverence for the peerlessly great men and made bows.

articles.title: Participants in Light Industrial Meeting Visit Consumer Goods Exhibition
articles.content:
Participants in Light Industrial Meeting Visit Consumer Goods Exhibition
 Pyongyang, March 14 (KCNA) -- Those to participate in a national meeting of light industrial workers Thursday visited the venue of a national consumer goods exhibition opened at the Three-Revolution Exhibition.
					 On display in the exhibition are more than 142,000 pieces of consumer goods from factories in the light industrial sector and living necessities production bases in Pyongyang and local areas, including those under the Ministry of Light Industry and the Ministry of Foodstuff and Daily Necessities Industry.
					
					 Among the exhibits are vinalon goods, tetron rayon fabrics, new velvet fabrics, sports shoes, sportswear, foodstuffs, cosmetics and household goods.
					
					 Going round the goods, the visitors realized that solid foundations were laid for bringing about leaping progress in the production of consumer goods thanks to the energetic efforts made by leader Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Local Army-People Rallies Hail Statement of KPA Supreme Command
articles.content:
Local Army-People Rallies Hail Statement of KPA Supreme Command
 Pyongyang, March 14 (KCNA) -- Army-people rallies took place in cities and counties, including Munchon City, Unryul, Sungho, Junghwa, Sepho, Hamju, Sinphyong and Koksan counties, to support the statement issued by a spokesman for the Supreme Command of the Korean People's Army (KPA).
					 Present there were service personnel, officials of local party and power organs and working people's organizations, officials and other people of industrial establishments and cooperative farms and teachers and students of universities and colleges.
					
					 At the rallies speakers denounced the U.S. imperialists for prodding the UN Security Council into cooking up an additional "resolution on sanctions" against the DPRK while staging large-scale war maneuvers for aggression.
					
					 All service personnel and people have turned out in an all-out action against the enemies in a do-or-die spirit, they said, stressing that a final victory is in store for the army and people of the DPRK all out to protect its sovereignty. They went on:
					
					 It is the final conclusion and will of the DPRK to settle accounts with the U.S., the sworn enemy, only with arms. All service personnel and people will wage a decisive battle with the hostile forces and certainly achieve the cause of national reunification.
					
					 Only victory and glory are in store for the Korean people advancing under the uplifted banners bearing the portraits of smiling President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il under the leadership of the dear respected Marshal Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Korean Committee for Solidarity with Cuba Meets
articles.content:
Korean Committee for Solidarity with Cuba Meets
 Pyongyang, March 14 (KCNA) -- An annual meeting of the Korean Committee for Solidarity with Cuba took place at the Taedonggang Diplomatic Club on Thursday.
					 Present there were Kim Sung Du, chairman of the Education Commission and chairman of the committee, So Ho Won, vice-chairman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries, and members of the Korean Committee for Solidarity with Cuba. 
					
					 Ambassador German Hermin Ferras Alvarez and staff members of the Cuban embassy here attended the meeting. 
					
					 The meeting reviewed the work done by the Korean Committee for Solidarity with Cuba over the past one year for friendship and solidarity with the Cuban people who are advancing under the banner of socialism while destroying the imperialists' sanctions and blockade and the moves to isolate and stifle Cuba, and protecting the country's sovereignty and revolutionary gains under the leadership of the Communist Party of Cuba. The meeting discussed the action program of the committee for this year.

articles.title: Economic Cooperation Bureau of Libya Hosts Reception
articles.content:
Economic Cooperation Bureau of Libya Hosts Reception
 Pyongyang, March 14 (KCNA) -- The Economic Cooperation Bureau of Libya Thursday hosted a reception at the Taedonggang Diplomatic Club to mark the day of the Libyan revolution. 
					 Invited to the reception were Choe Chang Sik, minister of Public Health, Kim Hyong Jun, Ri Myong San, Min Song Mo and other officials concerned, foreign diplomatic envoys and representatives of international organizations here. 
					
					 Chief of the Economic Cooperation Bureau Muhammad Mustafa and its members were on hand.

articles.title: Wheat, Barley Sowing Begins in DPRK
articles.content:
Wheat, Barley Sowing Begins in DPRK
 Pyongyang, March 14 (KCNA) -- Sowing of wheat and barley has begun in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea as part of efforts to carry out the policy of the Workers' Party of Korea for double-cropping.
					 Co-op farms across the country are now concentrating on the sowing to finish it as scheduled after preparing quality organic fertilizers and high-yield seeds, choosing fields suitable for double-cropping and finishing repair of farm machines.
					
					 Farms in Pyongyang City is taking the lead in this work while Chongdan, Unryul, Jaeryong, Pyoksong and Anak counties, South Hwanghae Province are doing it in the right time.
					
					 Farms in South Phyongan Province are endeavoring to meet technical requirements in the sowing.
					
					 The same holds true for the farms in North Phyongan and Hwanghae provinces.

articles.title: New Kind of Computer Developed in DPRK
articles.content:
New Kind of Computer Developed in DPRK
 Pyongyang, March 14 (KCNA) -- A new kind of computer, applicable to industrial establishments, was developed by the Noul Technology Joint Venture Company in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
					 The Noul-trademarked computer (5.7 and 10.4 inches) has already been introduced to Kim Chaek Iron and Steel Complex, Huichon Power Station, Pyongyang Cornstarch Factory and other production units.
					
					 This computer is less affected by temperature, humidity, rays and vibration. The serviceable life of it, with less production cost, is two times longer than other computers.
					
					 It is well received by workers and technicians because HMI was made in Korean language.

articles.title: Songun Politics Serves as Patriotic One: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Songun Politics Serves as Patriotic One: Rodong Sinmun
 Pyongyang, March 14 (KCNA) -- Songun politics serves as  patriotic one for achieving national reunification and defending the security of the nation and peace of the country.
					 Rodong Sinmun Thursday says this in a bylined article.
					
					 The Korean nation, strong in independent spirit and patriotism, was forced to ink a treaty for national ruin and had the whole country lost to the Japanese imperialists more than a hundred years ago as it failed to build up strong arms capable of protecting its sovereignty, the article notes, and goes on:
					
					 A moment is enough for ruining the country but it takes a thousand years to rebuild it. The same is the case with the sovereignty. This is a bitter lesson taught by history.
					
					 The same can be said of the present situation.
					
					 There has never been peace on the Korean Peninsula for over six decades of national division forced by foreign forces.
					
					 However, wars have been deterred under such grave situation and provokers failed to realize their attempts for aggression.
					
					 This was because the invincible Songun politics of the DPRK has firmly protected the peace on this land.
					
					 The matchless military muscle of the DPRK put an end to the history of distress the nation suffered for it was weak and this convinced the Koreans that they can successfully achieve durable peace of the country and national reunification.
					
					 Songun politics is matchless strength for resolutely foiling the anti-DPRK war hysteria of the U.S. imperialists and their stooges.
					
					 The DPRK has no option but to use diversified precision nuclear strike means of Korean style as the U.S. imperialists are working hard to invade it with nukes.
					
					 Eternal is the history of victory of the army and people of the DPRK thanks to the great Songun politics, the article concludes.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun on Will of Army and People of DPRK
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun on Will of Army and People of DPRK
 Pyongyang, March 14 (KCNA) -- It is the strong will of the service personnel and people of the DPRK to show the might of Songun Korea to those who violate the sovereignty of the DPRK, Rodong Sinmun Thursday says in a bylined article. 
					 The article goes on:
					
					 The U.S. imperialists and their allies' military threats and nuclear war preparations against the DPRK are all aimed to invade it and plunge the Korean Peninsula into the crucible of a horrible nuclear war. 
					
					 The strategic aim of the U.S. imperialists is to contain the DPRK by force and establish their military hegemony in Asia by provoking a new Korean war.
					
					 One can easily guess that nuclear war exercises can easily spill over into an actual war as the Asia-Pacific region around the Korean Peninsula is turning into the rendezvous of huge forces of the U.S. and its allies and into the theatre of operations. 
					
					 The situation proves that the DPRK was quite right when it chose the path of independence and Songun to react to the U.S. hostile policy with strength, not with words. The DPRK also realized that this is the way for defending the country and its sovereignty.
					
					 Now that the hostile forces' moves to encroach on the sovereignty and dignity of the DPRK have gone beyond the limit, it is left with a clear option.
					
					 It is the militant spirit and pluck of the army and people of the DPRK to counter the U.S. and its allies' vicious anti-DPRK moves with revolutionary offensive and their invasion with a revolutionary war.

articles.title: KCNA Slams Hostile Forces' Cry out for DPRK's "Dismantlement of Nukes"
articles.content:
KCNA Slams Hostile Forces' Cry out for DPRK's "Dismantlement of Nukes"
 Pyongyang, March 14 (KCNA) -- Hostile forces are persistently crying out for the DPRK's "dismantlement of nukes", jabbering that "a country focusing its efforts on military force including nukes is bound to perish."
					 What they utter is nothing but logic of a robber that only big powers are allowed to have nukes to dominate the world and outbursts of idiots unable to judge a reality. 
					
					 Nuclear deterrent serves as the most effective treasured sword for protecting sovereignty which nothing can substitute for in the present world where a country weak in strength is fated to abandon its sovereignty and become a slave. 
					
					 The DPRK's successful third nuclear test made it possible for it to have in place powerful physical means at a higher level capable of dealing merciless blows at whoever goes mad to stifle it no matter where he is on the earth and firmly protecting the country's sovereignty and security. 
					
					 It was none other than the U.S. that compelled the DPRK to have access to them.
					
					 Since early in the 1950s the U.S. has made ceaseless nuclear blackmail against the DPRK, compelling it to have access to nukes. 
					
					 No nation in the world is exposed to the most direct nuclear threat for such a long period as the Korean nation. The nuclear threat posed by the U.S. during the Korean War was a nightmare for the Korean people in the true sense of the word. MacArthur, commander of the U.S. forces in the Far East, blustered in December of 1950 that the U.S. would form a radioactive corridor in the northern part of Korea from the East Sea to the West Sea. There will be no living bodies in this corridor in 60 years or 120 years, he noted.
					
					 A long procession of A-bomb evacuees appeared on the Korean Peninsula during the war due to the U.S. A-bomb blackmail. This forced millions of Koreans to live separated into the north and the south still today.
					
					 The U.S. brought a great number of nuclear weapons to south Korea, turning it into the land with the densest distribution of nuclear weapons in the world.
					
					 The U.S. shipped and deployed the first batch of tactical nuclear weapons to south Korea in 1957, nuclearizing the peninsula. 
					
					 The U.S. deployment of nuclear weapons in south Korea has steadily increased and their number exceeded 1,000 in the mid-1970s.
					
					 The U.S. has escalated nuclear war exercises against the DPRK in a phased way.
					
					 The first U.S.-south Korea joint nuclear war exercises codenamed Focus Retina in 1969 was followed by Freedom Bolt, Team Spirit, RSOI, Key Resolve, Foal Eagle and Ulji Freedom Guardian for the past decades.
					
					 In the new century the U.S. designated the DPRK as part of an "axis of evil" and openly put it on the list of preemptive nuclear strike, escalating nuclear threats.
					
					 Such situation compelled the DPRK to manufacture nuclear weapons to avert a war and defend its social system and destiny.
					
					 The DPRK's access to nukes clearly proved to the world that the days are gone when the U.S. unilaterally made nuclear blackmail against it.
					
					 The Foreign Policy Focus said Bush approached the DPRK in a wild way militarily and diplomatically in the early days of his office and thus made the DPRK a nuclear weapons state. The New York Times said the DPRK's declaration of its possession of nukes is a "mistake" made by the U.S. administration by pushing the DPRK to isolation.
					
					 It is a bitter lesson drawn by the DPRK that only nukes can most reliably safeguard the security of the country and the nation.
					
					 Gone never to return are the days when the U.S. threatened and blackmailed the DPRK with A-bomb.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Adages are Valuable Assets: S. Korean Journalist
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Adages are Valuable Assets: S. Korean Journalist
 Pyongyang, March 14 (KCNA) -- The south Korean internet newspaper Jaju Minbo carried an article written by its representative Ri Chang Gi in prison praising leader Kim Jong Il.
					 The article recalled that slogan "Let us live not merely for today but for tomorrow" was put up on the classroom wall of a school in south Korea some day in the past. 
					
					 The slogan, an important quotation of Chairman of the National Defence Commission Kim Jong Il, taught a great lesson and gave strength to the students, Ri said, adding:
					
					 Recently posted on websites are lots of quotes from Kim Jong Il such as "Only fragrant flowers draw bees and butterflies and only kind officials draw people".
					
					 The author referred to the impressions he got seeing the book of important quotations of Kim Jong Il when he visited bookshops during his stay in Pyongyang.
					
					 Adages of Kim Jong Il are valuable assets of humankind, he stressed.
					
					 Study into the north will help one encounter touching stories that are related to President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il, he said.
					
					 There were many stories which he could not make public in fear of the charges with the violation of the "Security Law" and being branded as an "outrageous act", the author said, and stressed:
					
					 Those adages will be of great help to humankind.
					
					 Is it really necessary to brand everything from the north as bad and punish those following things of the north on charges of the violation of "Security Law" in the era of learning?
					
					 If this issue is taken to justice, this will become a laughing stock of the world.
					
					 The people and our future generations will take to heart the fact that there had been such a shameful happening in the history of the nation.
					
					 This is truly shameful. Let us please come to our senses.
					
					 This is an issue related to the elementary human ethics.

articles.title: US Hostile Policy toward DPRK Slammed by S. Korean
articles.content:
US Hostile Policy toward DPRK Slammed by S. Korean
 Pyongyang, March 14 (KCNA) -- Choe Un A, chairperson of the Independent Reunification Committee of the Solidarity for Progress of south Korea, on March 10 made public an article denouncing the U.S. for its hostile policy toward the DPRK.
					 The Key Resolve and Foal Eagle joint military exercises are war rehearsals for attacking the north by force in view of their program and scale, the article said.
					
					 As organizations of different circles made clear, the U.S. hostile policy toward the north resulted in threatening peace on the Korean Peninsula, it noted.
					
					 Tension on the peninsula will run high if the policy of pressurizing the north persists, it said.
					
					 It urged the U.S. to roll back its failed policy and stop the north-targeted joint military exercises.
					
					 It called upon the broad segments of people to turn out in the action for peace against war.

articles.title: S. Korean Organizations Declare Period of Actions against War
articles.content:
S. Korean Organizations Declare Period of Actions against War
 Pyongyang, March 14 (KCNA) -- Organizations in South Kyongsang Province including the South Kyongsang Provincial Headquarters of the South Side Committee for Implementing the June 15 Joint Declaration and the South Kyongsang Provincial Alliance for Progress held a press conference at the building of the provincial office on March 11 at which they declared a period of emergency actions against a war. 
					 At the press conference, speakers said that the U.S. and the south Korean authorities claim that the Key Resolve and Foal Eagle joint military drills are "defensive ones", but they are obviously offensive drills being staged under the simulated conditions of an all-out war against the north.
					
					 They voiced strong opposition to the war-like forces sticking to the policy of confrontation with the north, crying out for "a preemptive attack" upon the north.
					
					 They urged the U.S. to lift the failed "sanctions" against the DPRK, roll back the policy of pressure upon it and stop at once the joint military drills.

articles.title: Actions against War Maneuvers Go on in S. Korea
articles.content:
Actions against War Maneuvers Go on in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, March 14 (KCNA) -- Civic and public organizations in Pusan, south Korea are staging actions against the U.S. imperialists and the south Korean belligerent forces' maneuvers for a war against the DPRK.
					 The Pusan Headquarters of the South Side Committee for Implementing the June 15 Joint Declaration, the Pusan Women's Society, the Pusan Youth Association and other civic and public organizations held a press conference on March 11 at which they said the danger of a war is increasing on the Korean Peninsula due to the north-targeted war maneuvers.
					
					 Those who only think of running away overseas in case a war breaks out are crying out for making "punishment" and the like, the organizations said, urging the south Korean military belligerent forces stop acting rashly.
					
					 At the end of the conference its participants staged a demonstration in demand of a stop to the war maneuvers.
					
					 The Pusan Headquarters of the Confederation of Trade Unions in a statement on the same day condemned the Key Resolve and Foal Eagle joint military exercises as war maneuvers for attack aimed to "occupy the north".
					
					 Accusing the military belligerent forces of talking about "preemptive strike" on the north, the statement demanded an immediate end to the dangerous saber-rattling which may lead to a war on the Korean Peninsula.

articles.title: Stop to War Maneuvers Demanded by S. Korean Organizations
articles.content:
Stop to War Maneuvers Demanded by S. Korean Organizations
 Pyongyang, March 14 (KCNA) -- Press conferences took place in Kwangju and other parts in North and South Jolla provinces of south Korea on March 11 in protest against the Key Resolve and Foal Eagle joint military exercises being staged by the U.S. imperialists and the south Korean warmongers.
					 Present there were members of civic, public and religious organizations and political parties.
					
					 Members of civic, public and religious organizations in Kwangju belonging to the Kwangju-South Jolla Provincial Headquarters of the South Side Committee for Implementing the June 15 Joint Declaration said a touch-and-go situation is now prevailing on the Korean Peninsula. They expressed concern over the fact that a war is looming due to the "sanctions" against the north and the joint military exercises.
					
					  Opposition party members in Kwangju held that the present danger of war is attributable to the U.S. hard-line policy based on the one-sided "sanctions" against the DPRK.
					
					 They will turn out in actions together with the Kwangju citizens desirous of peace, they said, calling upon all political camp to positively join in the actions for peace against war.
					
					 The North Jolla Provincial Headquarters of the South Side Committee for Implementing the June 15 Joint Declaration and other civic and public organizations in North Jolla Province said that the danger of war will not be removed from the Korean Peninsula as long as the hostile policy toward the north persists.
					
					 The organizations noted that they would intensify the anti-war actions through candlelight rallies and demonstrations in Jonju, Kunsan and other places of the province.
					
					 The South Jolla Provincial Solidarity for Progress and other civic and public organizations of South Jolla Province noted they would conduct such actions as information service, candlelight rally and meeting on the situation in demand of the halt to Key Resolve and Foal Eagle.

articles.title: End to Anti-DPRK "Sanctions", War Drills Demanded
articles.content:
End to Anti-DPRK "Sanctions", War Drills Demanded
 Pyongyang, March 14 (KCNA) -- The U.S. Regional Headquarters of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification (Pomminryon) on March 10 held the 24th core members' meeting in Los Angeles at which it made public a statement condemning the hostile moves of the U.S. and its followers toward the DPRK.
					 The statement said that the UN should not just talk about "peace" and "stability" but lift all the anti-DPRK "sanctions."
					
					  The on-going Key Resolve and Foal Eagle joint war exercises will last for two months with latest war hardware involved at a time when the military tension on the Korean Peninsula has reached an extreme phase, the statement noted, adding that they are like a detonator to spark off a war.
					
					 Recalling that all war exercises have been staged under the simulated conditions of operations to "occupy the north" and a nuclear war, provoking the north and posing a great threat to the existence of the Korean nation and stability in Northeast Asia, the statement  demanded a prompt halt to the drills. 
					
					 It continued:
					
					 The north declared the Korean Armistice Agreement and all the north-south agreements on non-aggression invalid from March 11, the day Key Resolve kicked off. The root cause of this grave situation lies in the U.S. strategy for world domination and its hostile policy toward the DPRK as the U.S. rejected all its peace proposals.
					
					 It urged the present south Korean "government" not to take the lead in causing the ruin of the nation by following in the footsteps of the former Lee Myung Bak regime.
					
					 The U.S. Regional Headquarters of Pomminryon will stand firm against a war and will never tolerate any act of infringing upon the sovereignty of the nation, the statement warned.

articles.title: US-S. Korea Joint Military Exercises under Fire
articles.content:
US-S. Korea Joint Military Exercises under Fire
 Pyongyang, March 14 (KCNA) -- The Regional Headquarters of Commonwealth of Independent States of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification (Pomminryon) on March 10 released a statement denouncing the joint military exercises Key Resolve and Foal Eagle being staged by the U.S. and south Korean puppet forces. 
					 The war exercises involving huge nuclear strike forces and armed forces of satellite states are now being staged under the signboard of "annual exercises," the statement noted, adding that they bring to light the aggressive scenario of the U.S. to ignite a nuclear war on the Korean Peninsula in view of their scale and nature. 
					
					 The U.S. is the arch criminal threatening global peace and security as it is staging the dangerous nuclear war exercises in the biggest hotspot in the world where a tough-and-go situation prevails, the statement said, and went on: 
					
					 The Regional Headquarters of Commonwealth of Independent States of Pomminryon fully supports the just measures for self-defence declared by the Supreme Command of the Korean People's Army through the statement of its spokesman to protect the supreme interests of the country in view of the grave situation prevailing on the Korean Peninsula. 
					
					 The statement urged the U.S. and its allies to stop the war maneuvers for aggression at once.

articles.title: Korean in US Accuses S. Korean Authorities of Their Treachery
articles.content:
Korean in US Accuses S. Korean Authorities of Their Treachery
 Pyongyang, March 14 (KCNA) -- Ro Kil Nam, representative of Minjok Thongsin, internet newspaper of Koreans in the U.S, made public an article on March 5 in denunciation of the treachery of the south Korean puppet regime.
					 The article accused the south Korean authorities of sitting with folded arms despite GIs' crimes in the heart of Seoul and Japan's persistent claim to Tok Islets.
					
					 What merits a serous attention is that they are just clinging to the coattail of their American master and echoing his trumpeting about the "nuclear crisis caused by the north" though the U.S. is staging exercises for a nuclear war against the north where compatriots live,  escalating tension on the Korean Peninsula, the article said.
					
					 Referring to the actions of south Koreans from all walks of life for a stop to the Key Resolve and Foal Eagle joint military exercises for aggression, the article noted that the danger of war on the Korean Peninsula can never be defused through "sanctions" or pressure.
					
					 Peace and reunification of the peninsula can be achieved only when an end is put to the U.S. domination and interference in south Korea and the June 15 joint declaration and October 4 declaration are implemented, it stressed.

articles.title: Koreans in US Oppose War Maneuvers
articles.content:
Koreans in US Oppose War Maneuvers
 Pyongyang, March 14 (KCNA) -- Koreans in the U.S. launched actions to denounce the joint military exercises kicked off by the U.S. and south Korean puppet warmongers and their "sanctions" racket against the DPRK.
					 Koreans in Washington, Los Angeles, New York, Chicago and other areas of the U.S. on March 10 sent an open letter to the U.S. president in the name of the U.S. Regional Committee of the Overseas Side Committee for Implementing the June 15 Joint Declaration and other organizations and individuals.
					
					 They in the open letter said that "sanctions" and pressure are by no means a peaceful solution, adding the "sanctions" against the DPRK sparked off only tension and crisis in the past also.
					
					 They demanded an immediate start of the DPRK-U.S. dialogue for concluding a peace treaty on the Korean Peninsula, nullification of the UN Security Council's "resolution on sanctions" that was initiated by the U.S. and a halt to the U.S.-south Korea joint military exercises.
					
					 The Federation of Koreans in the U.S. in a statement on March 8 demanded the U.S. come out for dialogue with the north, not a war.
					
					 Members of the U.S. Central Regional Committee of the Overseas Side Committee for Implementing the June 15 Joint Declaration staged a demonstration in Chicago on March 9 denouncing the north-targeted war maneuvers.
					
					 Members of the U.S. Regional Committee of the Overseas Side Committee for Implementing the June 15 Joint Declaration and other Koreans in the U.S. staged a protest before the UN Headquarters in New York on March 11.
					
					 They demanded the U.S. stop at once all war maneuvers including the Key Resolve and Foal Eagle joint military exercises that wreak peace on the Korean Peninsula and increase the danger of a war there, products of the U.S. hostile policy toward the DPRK. 
					
					 There also took place before White House in Washington, and in Los Angeles and other areas of the U.S. demonstrations of Koreans in the U.S. to slam the U.S. hostile policy toward the DPRK.

articles.title: Day of Sun to Be Celebrated in Syria
articles.content:
Day of Sun to Be Celebrated in Syria
 Pyongyang, March 14 (KCNA) -- A Syrian preparatory committee for celebrating the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung (the Day of the Sun) was formed on March 6.
					 Saaeed Eleia Dawood, director of the Organizational Department of the Regional Leadership of the Syria's Baath Arab Socialist Party who doubles as chairman of the Syrian Arab-Korea Friendship Association, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The committee decided to organize diverse political and cultural events for celebrating the Day of the Sun as the most auspicious common holiday of humankind.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Praised as Peerlessly Elder Statesman in Nigeria
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Praised as Peerlessly Elder Statesman in Nigeria
 Pyongyang, March 14 (KCNA) -- The Nigerian National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea posted an article titled "Peerlessly great man who defends socialism by dint of idea, arms and unity" on its website on Mar. 3.
					 20 years ago leader Kim Jong Il published the work "Abuses of Socialism Are Intolerable" on March 1, which clarifies the principled issues arising in defending and accomplishing the cause of socialism such as the issues of regarding socialism as faith and putting it on a moral basis, the article said, and went on:
					
					 At the end of the last century the imperialists trumpeted about "complete collapse of socialism" and made vicious efforts to suffocate the DPRK politically, militarily and economically.
					
					 He consolidated the military position of Korean-style socialism with his original Songun politics.
					
					 Every steep mountain and forefront post of the DPRK such as Chol Pass, Mt. Osong, Cho Islet and Panmunjom are associated with the Songun leadership feats he performed with his iron will and superhuman energy.
					
					 Thanks to his devoted long journey the Korean People's Army turned into a powerful revolutionary Paektusan army, and the DPRK into a matchless military power with nuclear deterrent for self-defence.
					
					 He achieved the single-minded unity of whole society unbreakable with any nuclear weapons.
					
					 He was, indeed, a prominent thinker and theoretician, iron-willed commander and peerlessly elder statesman who always led the cause of socialism in the Songun era to victory by dint of idea, arms and unity.

articles.title: Statement of KPA Supreme Command Supported by Beninese Political Party
articles.content:
Statement of KPA Supreme Command Supported by Beninese Political Party
 Pyongyang, March 14 (KCNA) -- The Socialist Party of Benin released a statement on March 6 in support of the statement issued by a spokesman for the Supreme Command of the Korean People's Army (KPA).
					 The Socialist Party of Benin in the statement condemned Key Resolve and Foal Eagle joint military exercises against socialist Korea by the U.S. and south Korea as very irresponsible and dangerous reckless moves driving the situation to a collapse.
					
					 The U.S. and forces following it do not know that the DPRK is neither the Balkans nor Iraq and Libya, it said, adding:
					
					 Being convinced that the Workers' Party of Korea and the Korean people led by it will always emerge victorious, the Socialist Party of Benin fully supports the important measures taken by the Supreme Command of the KPA for a final victory.
					
					 We extend invariable solidarity to the WPK and Korean people in their just cause.

articles.title: US-S. Korea War Maneuvers under Fire
articles.content:
US-S. Korea War Maneuvers under Fire
 Pyongyang, March 14 (KCNA) -- The Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Chile (Proletarian Action) released a statement on March 5 to denounce Key Resolve and Foal Eagle joint military exercises by the U.S. and south Korean warmongers.
					 The statement said:
					
					 The U.S. are staging again Key Resolve and Foal Eagle joint military exercises to stifle the DPRK in a military way by mobilizing the south Korean army and even troops of its allies including UK and Australia.
					
					 The Communist Party of Chile (Proletarian Action) extends support and solidarity to the Workers' Party of Korea and the DPRK struggling against imperialism.
					
					 We strongly condemn the aggression moves of the U.S. against the DPRK.
					
					 We call on all the revolutionary and democratic anti-imperialist forces to support the Korean people in their just cause.
					
					 Yankees are running amuck to ignite a war but the party, state, army and people of the DPRK will frustrate all provocations.
					
					 The imperialists will reap the consequences of their reckless acts.
					
					 We hope that the world people will be interested in true and just news, not lending an ear to false reports released by media dutiful to the imperialists.

articles.title: Nepal, Pakistan Organizations Support Statement of KPA Supreme Command
articles.content:
Nepal, Pakistan Organizations Support Statement of KPA Supreme Command
 Pyongyang, March 14 (KCNA) -- Organizations of Nepal and Pakistan expressed full support for the statement issued by a spokesman for the Supreme Command of the Korean People's Army (KPA).
					 The Nepal Journalist Association and the Nepal Journalist Association for the Study of the Juche Idea and Songun Politics said in a joint statement on Mar. 7:
					
					 We resolutely denounce the U.S. for its hostile policy towards the DPRK, its escalating military threat and conspiratorial propaganda against the DPRK.
					
					 We, mouthpiece for justice and followers of the great Juche idea and Songun idea, insist that an end should be put to the high-handed practices of the U.S. and the forces kowtowing to it as they wantonly violate the independent right of a sovereign state and wreck the world peace.
					
					 If all the countries in the world and the international organizations sincerely wish for peace, they should make their efforts for the reunification on the Korean Peninsula, not taking issue with the satellite launch of a sovereign state and the nuclear test for safeguarding its sovereignty.
					
					 The Pakistan Labour Federation stated on Mar. 6:
					
					 The UN Security Council should retract the "resolutions on sanctions" against the DPRK.
					
					 All countries have their right to defend their security and sovereignty.
					
					 We will stand on the side of the Korean people who turned out to protect the country's security and sovereignty.

articles.title: Brazilian Organization Accuses US of Threatening Peace on Korean Peninsula
articles.content:
Brazilian Organization Accuses US of Threatening Peace on Korean Peninsula
 Pyongyang, March 14 (KCNA) -- The Brazilian Institute for the Study of the Juche Idea posted an article on its website on Mar. 1. The article termed the U.S. a provocateur threatening peace on the Korean Peninsula.
					 The article said:
					
					 The DPRK launched its satellites in 1998, 2009 and 2012.
					
					 Those the DPRK put into orbits were satellites, not "ballistic missiles".
					
					 The U.S. and the forces following it laid a stumbling block in the way of the independent economic development of the DPRK in a bid to stifle it, crying out for "stop to provocation" and touting "ratcheting-up of sanctions".
					
					 Sanctions and menace against the DPRK were not terminated even in the period when it suffered the severest natural disasters.
					
					 The situation on the Korean Peninsula became extremely tense due to the war drills that targeted the DPRK.
					
					 All facts clearly prove that "north's provocation" and "threats from the north" touted by the U.S. and south Korea were just whopping lies. 
					
					 The U.S., biggest nuclear giant, is the very country which threatens the world peace.
					
					 It has lots of military bases equipped with nuclear weapons in south Korea.
					
					 The military muscle of the DPRK is for self-defence and it is quite natural that the DPRK has made investment in the field of national defence as it has been exposed to constant war threats.
					
					 The story of "threats from the north" fabricated by the U.S. and south Korea is apparently a provocation against the DPRK.

articles.title: Statement of KPA Supreme Command Hailed by British Organizations
articles.content:
Statement of KPA Supreme Command Hailed by British Organizations
 Pyongyang, March 14 (KCNA) -- The British Association for the Study of Songun Policy the British Group for the Study of the Juche Idea and the British Branch of the Korean Friendship Association released a joint statement on Mar. 6 in support of the statement issued by a spokesman for the Supreme Command of the Korean People's Army (KPA).
					 The joint statement said that the U.S. imperialists and their satellite forces are working hard to encroach on the DPRK's legitimate right to use outer space for peaceful purposes.
					
					 This is just the violation of the sovereignty of the DPRK and the height of double standards, it noted, and went on:
					
					 The DPRK, however, will never remain a passive onlooker to it.
					
					 The U.S. has no qualification to take issue with the nuclear test conducted by the DPRK as the former has the hugest stockpile of nuclear weapons in the world and a variety of missiles and conducted lots of nuclear tests.
					
					 The U.S. hostile moves against the DPRK have recently gone beyond the danger limit.
					
					 The U.S. keeps staging large-scale military exercises together with south Korea while fabricating the anti-DPRK "resolutions on sanctions" by instigating the UN Security Council in a bid to retard the DPRK's economic development.
					
					 The on-going Key Resolve and Foal Eagle joint military drills are not ones for defence in the light of their scale, nature and period.
					
					 What should not be overlooked is that the U.S. imperialists dragged even their satellite states' forces into the drills.
					
					 All facts show that the U.S. imperialists are contemplating invading the DPRK and stifling Korean-style socialist system by force.
					
					 The U.S. imperialists are sadly mistaken if they think they can provoke the DPRK like Iraq.
					
					 The KPA led by the dear respected Marshal Kim Jong Un is strong enough to annihilate the U.S. imperialist aggressors at one blow and defend the country's sovereignty and achieve national reunification.
					
					 The Korean people are sure to win a final victory as they are led by Marshal Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Indonesian Political Party Supports Just Measures Taken by DPRK
articles.content:
Indonesian Political Party Supports Just Measures Taken by DPRK
 Pyongyang, March 14 (KCNA) -- The Pioneer Party of Indonesia expressed full support for the statement issued by a spokesman for the Supreme Command of the Korean People's Army (KPA).
					 The party in a statement on Mar. 7 said:
					
					 The statement issued by a spokesman for the KPA Supreme Command declared that the DPRK would take the second and third strong practical counteractions in succession, totally nullify the Korean Armistice Agreement and stop all the activities of the Panmunjom mission of the KPA.
					
					 The Pioneer Party of Indonesia fully supports the important measure as just step for defending the sovereignty and dignity of the nation and the supreme interests of the country.
					
					 The U.S. and the forces following it should immediately stop their racket for additional "sanctions" against the DPRK and adventurous joint military exercises.
					
					 The U.S. should clearly understand the revolutionary mettle of the army and people of the DPRK that never make an empty talk.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un dirige ejercicios de tiro de subunidades artilleras
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un dirige ejercicios de tiro de subunidades artilleras
Pyongyang, 14 de marzo (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un, Primer Secretario del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Primer Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea, dirigio los ejercicios de tiro preparados para revisar la capacidad en combate real de las subunidades artilleras de la zona candente que se movilizaran en el golpe a la isla Taeyonphyong y la Paekryong.
					Luego de recibir el informe sobre el plan de tiro de combate y el estado de ubicacion de las subunidades artilleras, ordeno iniciar el fuego.
					
					En medio de la tronada de canonazos, los obuses navegaron velozmente surcando el aire y dieron impactos intensivos en los simulados blancos enemigos.
					
					Cada vez que los artilleros batian los blancos, el Mariscal se mostro muy satisfecho por el buen tiro.
					
					Al ver con binoculos la explosion espectacular de los proyectiles certeros disparados por los artilleros de las unidades de defensa de las islas radicadas en la zona mas candente del frente suroeste, evaluo que son mejores la unidad de defensa de la isla Jangjae y la otra heroina de la isla Mu y sobresale el canon heroe de esta ultima.
					
					En los ejercicios, los artilleros de las unidades citadas recibieron la evaluacion mas alta del Comandante Supremo.
					
					El Mariscal senalo que los artilleros pudieron lograr el exito de hoy porque realizan intensamente los ejercicios pensando siempre en el dia de combate.
					
					Cuando inspeccione los puestos avanzados del frente suroeste y el occidental, fije el orden de ataque a precision y la densidad de fuego a los blancos, dijo y subrayo que a traves del tiro de de hoy, los artilleros del cuerpo no.4 del EPC pasaron la prueba de su preparacion para aniquilar a los enemigos de la isla Taeyonphyong y la Paekryong.
					
					Como digo siempre, la guerra moderna es el combate de canones y la preparacion al combate de artilleros es la de todo el EPC y uno de los factores importantes que deciden la victoria en la guerra por la reunificacion de la patria, subrayo y presento las tareas para incrementar las fuerzas artilleras.
					
					El invito a Pyongyang a los artilleros de las unidades de defensa de la isla Jangjae y la Mu y se fotografio con ellos.
					
					Le acompanaron Choe Ryong Hae, Hyon Yong Chol, Kim Kyok Sik, Pak To Chun, Ri Yong Gil, Son Chol Ju, Kim Yong Chol, Pak Jong Chon, Rim Kwang Il, Ri Song Guk, Ri Yong Rae, Kim Myong Nam y An Ji Yong.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un felicita a Xi Jinping por su eleccion como presidente de RPCh
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un felicita a Xi Jinping por su eleccion como presidente de RPCh
Pyongyang, 14 de marzo (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un, Primer Secretario del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y Primer Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, envio el dia 14 un mensaje de felicitacion a Xi Jinping, Secretario General del Comite Central del Partido Comunista de China y Presidente de la Republica Popular China y de la Comision Militar Central de la RPCh.
					El texto sigue:
					
					Extiendo mis calidas felicitaciones a Vd. por su eleccion como Presidente de la RPCh y de la Comision Militar Central en el primer periodo de sesiones de la XII Legislatura de la Asamblea Popular Nacional de la Republica Popular China.
					
					Su eleccion como lider del Estado constituye un testimonio de alta estimacion y confianza que le depositan el pueblo y el ejercito chinos.
					
					Deseo que bajo la direccion del PCCh que le tiene como Secretario General, el pueblo chino logre mayores exitos en la construccion general de una sociedad socialista basicamente acomodada.
					
					Nuestro partido y el gobierno de la RPDC se mantienen en su invariable posicion de apreciar la amistad Corea-China y desarrollarla.
					
					Convencido de que las tradicionales relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre Corea y China continuaran desarrollandose magnificamente gracias a los esfuerzos conjuntos de ambas partes, hago votos por los exitos en sus responsabilidades.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un envia mensajes de respuesta a jefes de estado de varios paises
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un envia mensajes de respuesta a jefes de estado de varios paises
Pyongyang, 14 de marzo (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un, primer Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, envio mensajes de respuesta a los lideres de estado de varios paises quienes le hicieron llegar cartas de felicitacion con motivo del 71o aniversario del dia de nacimiento del Dirigente Kim Jong Il.
					Los destinatarios son Thein Sein, presidente de la Union de Myanmar, Bashar al-Assad, presidente de la Republica Arabe de Siria, Joseph Kabila Kabange, presidente de la Republica Democratica del Congo, y Yoweri Kaguta Museveni, presidente de la Republica de Uganda.
					
					En cada mensaje, el remitente expreso la conviccion de que se amplien y se fortalezcan mas las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre Corea y los respectivos paises y deseo a los destinatarios exitos en sus labores por la estabilidad y la prosperidad del pais.

articles.title: Portavoz de MINREX denuncia al secretario general de ONU
articles.content:
Portavoz de MINREX denuncia al secretario general de ONU
Pyongyang, 14 de marzo (ACNC) -- En entrevista con la ACNC concedida en relacion con que el secretario general de la ONU calumnia a la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea sumandose abiertamente a la politica hostil a esta de Estados Unidos, el portavoz del Ministerio de Relaciones Exteriores de la RPDC dio el dia 14 la siguiente respuesta:
					Recientemente, Ban Ki-Moon, secretario general de la ONU calumnia a la sagrada dignidad y soberania de la RPDC amparando los actos hostiles de EE.UU. contra esta.
					
					El dijo que "expresa grave preocupacion por la accion de violacion de la resolucion del Consejo de Seguridad de la ONU" y " la Direccion coreana debe renunciar el programa nuclear y esforzarse por la mejora de la vida de la poblacion" cuestionando el lanzamiento de satelite con fines pacificos  y la prueba nuclear independiente de la RPDC, en tanto amparo todos los ejercicios de guerra de agresion de EE.UU. contra esta.
					
					Esto significa que el se adhirio abiertamente a las maniobras de aislamiento y aplastamiento de las fuerzas hostiles a un Estado soberano, pais miembro de la ONU, olvidandose hasta del elemental principio de actividades como funcionario de la organizacion internacional.
					
					Aunque trabaja de secretario general de la ONU, el no se libera del tiempo del ministro de Relaciones Exteriores y de Comercio del Sur de Corea, razon por la cual algunos preguntan si es Ban el portavoz del departamento de Estado norteamericano o el ministro de Relaciones Exteriores y de Comercio del Sur de Corea.
					
					Por eso, Ban debe mantenerse conforme a su cargo en la neutralidad, imparcialidad y objetividad en sus trabajos.
					
					Si tiene la minima conciencia de un coreano no debe echar lena al fuego siendo lacayo de EE.UU. sino hacer con su juicio los trabajos utiles a la unidad de la nacion y la reunificacion pacifica del pais.
